title: Sabres Lose to Undefeated Canadiens 7-2
text:
Sabres Lose to Undefeated Canadiens 7-2 The Sabres fall to the Montreal Canadiens 7-2 at home. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Sabres Lose to Undefeated Canadiens 7-2 Nick Mendola, Associated Press 11:10 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Oct 23, 2015; Buffalo, NY, USA; Montreal Canadiens left wing Max Pacioretty (67) in front of Buffalo Sabres center Jack Eichel (15) during the first period at First Niagara Center. Mandatory Credit: Timothy T. Ludwig-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Timothy T. Ludwig, Timothy T. Ludwig-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) - Andrei Markov had a goal and four assists and the Montreal Canadiens beat the Buffalo Sabres 7-2 on Friday night to run their season-opening winning streak to eight games. 
The Canadiens are two victories away from matching the NHL record set by the Toronto Maple Leafs in 1993-94 and matched by the Sabres in 2006-07. 
Brendan Gallagher and Dale Weise each scored twice, and Max Pacioretty and Torrey Mitchell also scored. Mike Condon made 34 saves, and P.K. Subban and Tomas Plekanec each had three assists. Read or Share this story: http://on.wgrz.com/1S1NbyM More Stories
